name: Renaissance St. Croix Carambola Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I hadn't been to St. Croix before this trip and didn't know what to expect or where to stay. Because I travel frequently for business and have come to trust Marriott properties, we settled on this resort. It didn't hurt that I could use points for the stay....
reviews.title: Paradise on St. Croix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read some negative reviews about the resort prior to arriving, so we tried to reduce our expectations.
reviews.title: Great get away or place to enjoy time with the family without the fuss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything (and I mean EVERYTHING) about this resort far exceeded our expectations, however.
reviews.title: Great hotel off the beaten path

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is well kept and lushly landscaped. When compared to any other place we saw while driving around the island, I rate this the tops. All common areas were impeccably clean and reasonably new.
reviews.title: Renaissance St. Croix USVI

reviews.text: The pool area is large and there is very nice Frontgate furniture surrounding the pool deck. It is conveniently located next to the restaurant/bar. The beach is only a few steps away.
reviews.title: Very nice property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful resort where we spent our honeymoon August 7-11, 2012. Spectacular views, pristine beach, excellent snorkeling (sea turtles and sting rays...Gwen and Mel at Sweet Bottom Dive Shop are very knowledgeable and oh so nice and friendly) good food and very helpful staff. Absolutely loved that Carambola's location is so very private...at the end of the road...only people there are the people staying there. The bed was amazing...best sleep ever. Cannot say the same for the shower...although very spacious and clean, had extremely low pressure, no lighting inside shower area and never truly had "hot" water. Water pressure and temperature from bathroom sinks were fine.
reviews.title: Tran~quil~li~ty

reviews.text: 1. Rent a car. We rented from Judi of Croix...Christie was very understanding with our flight delay and changing our arrangements...even brought the car to us at the hotel! It is very easy to drive on the left. This should not stop you from renting a car...spending lots of money on taxi service should...never say public transportation. Street signs are non-existent, but the route markers are fairly well posted.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Snorkel! Especially at Davis Beach (Carambola) and drive out to Udall Point and hike to Isaac Bay. We would have hiked to Jack Bay as well, but didn't see the path until we were almost back to our car. Also went to Sunset Beach (Fredricksted) and Rainbow Beach (Rt. 80...this is a major party beach.)
reviews.title: Beautiful gem hidden in a cove!

reviews.text: 3. Bug spray and sunscreen are a must! Be prepared...if you need to purchase more sunscreen prices range from $11-$18 per bottle at Plaza Extra.
reviews.title: Return Trip, Even Better Than The First

reviews.text: 4. We had great meals at Rum Runners (boardwalk in Christensted), Ziggy's (on highway out to Udall Point) Flamboyant (Carambola's restaurant) Lost Dog Pub (dive bar in Fredricksted for flat bread pizza and pasta) Luncheria (delicious Mexican in Christensted) and to die for homemade ice cream at Rowdy Joe's (Rt. 80...dinner was fair at best.)
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.text: Definitely not up to normal Marriott standards. The rooms have supposedly been recently renovated but I couldn't vouch for that. We had two rooms. The hotel had to spray one for bugs and the ants were still everywhere!! One room was missing the door for the shower/toilet area. The other room was missing the table on the porch. The bug screen on one porch was full of holes so we were constantly bitten by no-see-ums. Because we went during the off season (aka hurricane season), there were fewer hotel staff on duty. There was ONE woman cooking for the restaurant. If you arrived at the restaurant right after another table, you had to wait an hour to get your food. The wi-fi internet was very weak and intermittent. My kids were trying to do their online homework and had to give up. I will say the staff were very friendly people at the hotel, the dive shop, and the gift shop. Even the groundskeepers were great; they cut down some coconuts for us and chopped them open with their machettes. The location can't be beat, but the buildings were more like a run down Motel 7 than a Marriott partner hotel.
reviews.title: Mediocre facility in an incredibly beautiful location

reviews.text: We did not stay at the resort as we had rented a private residence. We had access to the amenities at the Renaissance and I regret not using them more. The beach was absolutely beautiful, clean and I had the best nap ever lying there in the lawn chairs. The restaurant has a buffet and a restaurant. The restaurant has a limited menu but excellent food and drinks. You have to try the crispy steak salad. Yummy. I ordered mine without the cheese and had to send it back. Whoever heard of anyone not wanting cheese? Well, people who cannot eat it, that's who.. Our waitress was wonderful though with her very charming self.
reviews.title: Lovely atmostphere

reviews.text: One thing you must know about the island... they run out of stuff, things, ingredients, potatoes, oatmeal... you name it they may be out of it at any given moment. We kind of got used to that but when they told us at the resort that they were out of whiskey (Jack Daniels) and could not make my friend's Lynchberg Lemonade, we were astounded. Who ever heard of a bar running out of whiskey???? But, just as we were discussing alternatives, the manager came round and told them all they had to do was move one bottle aside and there was the whiskey. So I am wondering, really, if the iHOP had really run out of oatmeal the morning before? I mean who runs out of oatmeal? You can keep the grains for decades without any deterioration!
reviews.title: Nice rooms

reviews.text: I ordered a virgin Mojito and was rewarded by all the ingredients being on the island at the same time which resulted in me getting the most delicious one ever. We ate there twice. The lunch menu was a short version of the short dinner menu. My advice is to at least check out the buffet before you decide. But overall, it is a beautiful place. I'd go there again, if I wanted to visit St. Croix again, I'd go to the resort just for the photo ops.
reviews.title: Perfect Island Getaway

reviews.text: Im a very picky traveler. The staff have been very friendly and accommodating during our staff. This is our last night here and I'm so glad we switched hotels. The resort rooms are very spacious and beautifully designed with modern dark furnishing.,I love the plantation shutters design window and doors that open up to let more light in and can be opened up completely . It makes the room feel very carribean styled. I love the huge bathroom. The room is a plus. Unfortunately we are not fans of the usvi beaches. since I was just in cancun earlier in the week this can't compare although the ocean is vast. Overall I'm certain this one of the best hotels in the vi. I actually prefer it over the ritz Carlton in St. Thomas and would return to this hotel if I ever find myself back in the v.i. We have ordered room service daily sometimes twice a day. The food has been aboved average. Love the steak sandwich and the jerk chicken which was seasoned and moist. Overall the v. I. not my favorite destination but thanks to the renaissance we have had a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: This resort belongs in Hawaii--you'll feel you are.

reviews.text: We love Carambola, we often will go there for the weekend to relax by the wonderful pool. They always have great, prompt, a friendly pool side staff. Some rooms have been updated with little kitchens and new bathrooms, but the rooms still have caribbean charm. We love the big screened in porches that each room has, some looking out over the water or to the beautifully maintained grounds. Make sure if you are there on a Friday to check out the moko jumbies on Friday nights. They happen after the pirates buffet, which we usually skip and go to EAT@ cane bay instead, and then head back to watch the moko jumbies. Over all we've always had a great time there and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel
Perfect quiet
reviews.text: We went last minute wanting total beautiful quiet. This fit the bill. Very remote, clean, great staff, beautiful views. Food was average though. Cabs are expensive if you want to get anywhere else but great spot to relax. Rooms were big, including bathroom. Pool and hot tub, spa on site.

reviews.title: Best time ever
reviews.text: My cousin travels a lot and recommended this to me. Fantastic! Wish I could have spent more time and will definitely be back as soon. I can. American non stop and now jet blue through PR. Staff and hotel all super friendly and so helpful. Food was fantastic and bartenders happy and responsive. Dive shop way cool and coming back to get certified with them on next trip. Hiked over to tidal pools and felt like I had the world all to myself! Plenty of things to do around the resort and some cool. Are to hang down along the beach. Golf course is decent too as its a Robert Trent jones design. Love the new rooms marriott did and all the conveniences including a radio for my iPhone and marble floors and bath. Ocean waves put me to deep sleep every night. Batteries fully recharged and dieing to get back. So many places, so little time

I used to go there when there was nothing there at all, a locals beach at the end of a pot holed dirt road. Old Dan Dan used to stop cars asking for money to let you go to the beach, this was his own thing, and back then when rum was less than a dollar a bottle would do the trick. The beach is the same beautiful place it always was with some of the best snorkeling, diving, and waves of any beach on the island. The resort is very nice but I never stayed there so can't comment on the rooms, the food is in the restaurant/bar reasonable, I really liked the chicken caesar salad. A great place to spend the afternoon. I will be going back next time I'm on island.
reviews.title: Davis Bay (Carambola)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has to be the best place I have ever visited. The staff was very accomadating and were genuinely friendly and would bend over backwards to make sure your stay was satisfactory. We purchased a breakfast package for our stay of 6 days 5 nights and was well worth the money paid. Two items to check out is the Carribean stuffed french toast and the Banana almond rum pancakes. The room was very spacious and comfortable, the bedding was excellent, and the staff kept the rooms clean. The beach is probably the best one on the island and it doesnt hurt that its gated so you dont have to worry abut stragglers. We were told by the locals on several occaisions that we were staying at the best spot on the island. We would definitely do this again!
reviews.title: Paradise!

aka: Renaissance St. Croix Carambola Beach Hotel St. Croix
